byline: Mark Garrison, Molly Wood, Scott Tong and Bruce Johnson
description: Google Reader is dead. Millions once used it to keep track of websites and blogs all in one place -- now they are up for grabs. And an array of gadgets will track your fitness program, tell you in great detail how many calories you're burning, and what your heart rate is. They can even give you a kick when you are falling short of your goals.
title: Marketplace Tech for Monday, July 1, 2013
teaser: Google Reader is dead. Millions once used it to keep track of websites and blogs all in one place -- now they are up for grabs. And an array of gadgets will track your fitness program, tell you in great detail how many calories you're burning, and what your heart rate is. They can even give you a kick when you are falling short of your goals.
